turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Tell us, Jeanne... do you often hear this voice?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Is it here?  Now?  In this room?

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Let me clarify things for you, Jeanne.  On the one hand there is the Church Triumphant, that is to say God, his saints, and the souls that are saved.  And then there is the Church Militant, that is to say our Holy Father the Pope, the cardinals, the prelates of the Church, the clergy, and all good Catholic Christians.  Moreover this Church, when assembled, is guided by the Holy Spirit and therefore cannot be in error.  That is why we ask you to submit to the Church Militant... that is to say, us.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: So it is the Church Militant that refuses to confess me, and so prevents me from being a good Christian?

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: It is for us to determine whether you are a good Christian, not you.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I am sent by God, and I submit all my words and deeds to His judgment. Or do you think that you are better judges than He is?

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Jeanne, I beg of you... sign!  In God's name, don't you understand? I'm trying to save you!  If you don't sign, the English will burn you to death!  Is that what you want??

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No... I want to be confessed.

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Sign this, and I will confess you myself if you want.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: And may I go to Mass?

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: As often as you like -- now, please -- for the love of God -- sign!!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Please... may I have it back...

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: You have nothing to regret...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I didn't mean it!  I didn't know what I was signing!  You tricked me...!

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Silence her!  Take her away...!

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: I don't understand, Jeanne... why did you do it?  Why?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: And you?  Why did you lie?  You promised I could be confessed...

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: I know, Jeanne... it was the only way to save you from the fire!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: It's not my body I want to save. It's my soul.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I ask only one thing... to hear me in confession...

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: I -- I can't Jeanne... I can't hear your confession... I'm sorry...

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Good day, sir.  I trust my honorable Duke of Burgundy is feeling well?

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: He's feeling wonderful.

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Thanks be to God.

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: And your Duke?  The Duke of Bedford?

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: Not so well, I regret to say.  This business with the Maiden... it's caused him endless grief and torment.  That's why he's entrusted me with the task of... shall we say...

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: Buying her?

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: This word is -- regrettably appropriate for the situation.  In fact what we -- the Church -- wish to do is determine whether or not this girl is sent by God, as she claims.  You understand that we cannot allow just anybody to abuse God's name in this manner...

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: I understand.  How much?

turns.speaker: CAUCHON
turns.text: 20,000?!  But... I heard King Charles was... financially embarrassed.

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: Don't look at the cost, look at what it brings.  What is your last offer?

turns.speaker: YOLANDE
turns.text: Your health and happiness has always been my first concern, Charles... ever since you were a little boy -- and I think I know you better than your own mother...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: You think?

turns.speaker: YOLANDE
turns.text: Mmmm.  Yes.  I know for example the sickness that plagues your heart.  I know how painful it is for you... to have loved a father... without ever knowing if he really was yours.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: W-w-what has that got to do with this Maiden?

turns.speaker: YOLANDE
turns.text: Who better than a messenger from God to give answers to your questions?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: You really think she's been sent... by God?

turns.speaker: YOLANDE
turns.text: You're a fine judge of character, Charles.  It'll take you less than five minutes to expose her if she's a fake.  But if she's not -- then she will give you your answers... and place the crown on your head.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: You will??

turns.speaker: YOLANDE
turns.text: For the sake of France, Charles. And for the sake of my grandson.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: It's true.  There's only one king... people need to be reminded of that. Nevertheless... Jeanne has done so much for us...

turns.speaker: YOLANDE
turns.text: I assure you, Charles, the Maiden has no greater admirer than myself. But whatever our personal feelings, we cannot allow her to conduct her own private war.  For the sake of the kingdom, it is imperative that you stop her going to Compiegne...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: I... I can't stop her.

turns.speaker: YOLANDE
turns.text: Don't worry, Charles.  If God is still with her, she will be victorious.  We're not her judges... we're just spectators.  Let her go to Compiegne, as you let her go to Orleans, and let God decide her fate.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: But... her army's so small now...

turns.speaker: YOLANDE
turns.text: Then her faith will have to be bigger.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: There's no need to be afraid, sire.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: I'm... I'm not the king...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I know you're not yet -- but you will be, soon.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: What was my mission?  To help my country?  But how could I do that? I was only a poor girl who knew nothing about riding or making war... so I decided to wait and not to speak to anyone about it.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: You did well...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I didn't wait long.  One day I was going to Mass, like I do every day, when the same strange wind started blowing again...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: ... and what... what did he say?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: He said that I have to save France from her enemies and give her back to God, and He told me that I -- Jeanne -- will lead you to the altar at Rheims to be crowned King of France.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I don't need lodgings if we're to be marching on Orleans...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Orleans has held out for six months. I don't suppose a few days will make much difference.  Take some rest.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Ah, Jeanne... come here...!  This whole coronation idea of yours is a fiasco... nothing is ready...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: ... You look wonderful...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: ... and my crown doesn't fit and...  Really??

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Get them out of here!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Now hold on -- you're not captain here... on the battlefield perhaps, but not in the royal bedchamber!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Why did you betray me?  Paris was ours for the taking!  All I needed was another few hundred men... Why did you take back the army you gave me?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Gave you?  Well now, I wouldn't quite put it like that...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: So how would you put it?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Well... we are, of course, enormously grateful for your past efforts, but your task is done.  Now it's time for negotiation... and after many months of skillful work, our dear Tremoille is about to seal a treaty with our Burgundian friends who will no longer lend their support to the English.  You see, my dear Jeanne... as it is written in the Bible, "to everything there is a season:  a time for war, and a time for peace"...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Peace will only be got from the English at the end of a lance!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Why do you have to be so bloodthirsty?  Do you enjoy it?  All that blood and noise and pain? Diplomacy is far more civilized... far safer... and far cheaper...

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: She pretends she's been sent by God! These charlatans -- it's a pity there isn't enough wood to burn them all!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: She says she'll be here tomorrow...!

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: You mustn't see her, my lord.  We know nothing about her... we don't even know if she is from Lorraine.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: What difference does it make where she comes from?

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: If she comes from Burgundy it makes a difference.  It might be a trap...  Look... Signed "X".  What sort of name is "X"?  Or must we conclude that a messenger of God can't even write her own name?

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: Not exactly.  She wants you to give her an army -- at your expanse.  Bearing in mind that your mother stole every last piece of gold in the treasury, I fail to see how you can afford such an adventure.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: I can see her if I want to.  I mean, with half of France in the hands of the English, what have I got to lose?

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: The other half.

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: Your majesty, I urge you not to see this woman.  It all reeks of a Burgundian trap!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: My astrologers assure me that the hour is p-p-propitious -- Leo, with Virgo rising.  Have you ever noticed on the astrological chart how the Virgin is next to the Lion?

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: Supposing she's an assassin?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Tremoille, I'm not even king yet... who'd want to assassinate me?

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: Your majesty, I really think you...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: My dear loyal Tremoille, I know I can count on you...

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: ... as always, majesty...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: ... to ensure our privacy.  I need to talk to her.  Alone.

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: My captains have sworn their support.

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: No doubt your captains will fight for your fine cause -- but what about the ordinary soldier?  They don't fight for causes these days. They fight for money.  Who's going to pay them?

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: He's probably right -- let's call a delay...

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: There's no time, sire -- we can't hold up the ceremony... there's no telling when the English might come back... they're only ten leagues away...

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: Let them come!  Let them see who's the true king of France!

turns.speaker: CHARLES
turns.text: I... I don't know... it'll sound like we... betrayed her...?

turns.speaker: TREMOILLE
turns.text: Noooo!

turns.speaker: D'ESTIVET
turns.text: When you saw your king for the first time, was there an angel over his head?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: If there was, I didn't see it...

turns.speaker: D'ESTIVET
turns.text: Then why did your king believe in you without any proof?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Go and ask him yourself.

turns.speaker: D'ESTIVET
turns.text: You told us about the appearance of this... voice.  What exactly did you see?  Part of it... or all of it?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: His face.

turns.speaker: D'ESTIVET
turns.text: Does he have hair?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: D'ESTIVET
turns.text: Is it long and hanging down?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I'm more interested in what he says, not what he looks like.

turns.speaker: D'ESTIVET
turns.text: But if the devil were to take on the physical appearance of a saint or an angel... or a man... how would you recognize him?  By what he said?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Go on to the next question.

turns.speaker: D'ESTIVET
turns.text: That's enough!  You will answer the question... or face the consequences!

turns.speaker: REGNAULT
turns.text: 5,000 gold crowns.

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: That's not a lot.

turns.speaker: REGNAULT
turns.text: It is all his majesty can afford. He has even donated his very own personal savings.  His majesty will greatly appreciate a gesture of good will in this delicate negotiation between our two families.

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: I know... but the English want her very badly, and I have to tell you that they are proving much more generous.

turns.speaker: REGNAULT
turns.text: May I, without offending you, inquire how generous?

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: 20,000 gold crowns.

turns.speaker: REGNAULT
turns.text: 8,000.  We can't raise more... We can only place ourselves at the mercy of your generosity.

turns.speaker: DIJON
turns.text: I must offer to the Duke.  I will give you his answer tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Were you sent by Lord Dunois?

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Yes... they were.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Good.  Where are the English?

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Everywhere.  Where is the food?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: It's coming -- I rode on ahead.  I have to speak with the Captain of the English army... his name's Talbot...

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: I know...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Good.  Can you bring me to him?

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: He's on the other side of the river.

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Wait, wait...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: For what?

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Because... because -- I mean -- the English have a broad sense of humor, but... I mean, you don't understand... to them you're a witch, working for the devil.  What makes you think they'll listen to you?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Because if they don't, I'll raise such a war-cry against them that they will remember us forever!

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Well.  I'd love to see that, but after taking counsel with my captains, I felt it would be better to first bring the food into the city, then wait till Alencon arrives with reinforcements before doing anything.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: You may have been with your counsel, but I've been with mine, and I'm telling you, God's counsel is wiser than yours, and he's telling me to speak to the English -- now!

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Fine -- go now if you want, but not with me!  You may have a duty to God but I have a duty to my people, and my people are starving!  So right now I'm going to take the food back to the city, and if you can please calm down, and let me accompany you to Orleans, it will be my honor to welcome you.

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: So... what is the message?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: We offer the English a last chance to return home in peace.  If they refuse, we recross the river and attack them here -- at the Tourelles.

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Jeanne, that really makes no sense at all.  The Tourelles is virtually impregnable... besides, if we're on the other side of the river attacking the Tourelles, what's to stop Talbot attacking the city from the north?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: God.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: You know, I feel a great sorrow for you, because you're laughing now, but by tomorrow night some of you will be dead and having to repeat your jokes in front of God.

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Jeanne, with respect -- we can't just attack the Tourelles like that -- it's a very complicated matter and...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: What complicated about it?  All you have to do is do what you're told -- what could be simpler than that? I'm the drum on which God is beating out his message -- beating so loudly it's bursting my ears -- but you're all so full of your own voices, you're deaf to His!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: "Be patient, be patient"... is that the only advice you can ever come up with??  I've shown more patience than a dozen saints!

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Jeanne, you have to understand -- it's not easy for us -- I mean for our pride -- to suddenly be usurped by a -- well, with all due respect, by a... girl.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Ah, so that's it.  To you I'm just a girl.

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Jeanne, put yourself in my shoes for a moment -- how would you feel, if you were me?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Knowing what I know?  Enormous gratitude.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Dunois... was it you who ordered the attack?  Answer me?!

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Can we -- uh -- discuss this later?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Sooner is better than later!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Position the long-bows over there, crossbows over there -- and set up Dijon Culverins either side of those trees...

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: The wind will be against us...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: The wind will be with us!  Do as I say.

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: What's going on?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: We're taking back the Tourelles!

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Jeanne, what are you doing with that... you've got it back to front...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I know what I'm doing, so either lend a hand or go back to bed!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Stand by with the battering-rams...

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: We need another ten minutes...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: The bridge won't wait!

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Well...?  Shall we go?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Not yet.

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: The English won't wait.

turns.speaker: XAINTRAILLES
turns.text: My lord Dunois... I have wonderful news! -- finally -- he's sending her to us -- thanks be to God -- we're saved -- it's wonderful!

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Calm yourself, Xaintrailles.  Now slowly.  Who has finally done what?

turns.speaker: XAINTRAILLES
turns.text: The Dauphin -- he's sending us food -- and supplies -- and an army -- led by Jeanne -- the maiden from Lorraine -- isn't it wonderful?!

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Yes, it's a miracle.

turns.speaker: XAINTRAILLES
turns.text: And it's not the first one!  They say she saved a little boy who was dying of...

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: Xaintrailles...!  Don't talk to me about miracles...  If I was still sitting there waiting for a miracle, I'd be dead now. Anyway...

turns.speaker: XAINTRAILLES
turns.text: But... don't you think we should at least... go and... welcome her?

turns.speaker: DUNOIS
turns.text: As long as she brings food and supplies, she'll be welcome.

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Brilliant idea... but to be really effective, why not send a whole army of virgins?

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: That'll put fire in my soldiers!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: God... why of course -- we'd forgotten about him!  Strange, I don't seem to remember seeing him at Agincourt.

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Damn right!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Oh, but I forgot!  It was a Sunday... that explains it.  God's day off.

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: I do love her when her fire gets well and truly stoked!

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Me too...

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: There must be something we can do for her for Chrissakes!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Yes.  We can pray.

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Good idea...

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: This is no good!

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: No good?  This is a disaster!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: And... what does Jeanne think?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I don't think.  I leave that to God. I'm nothing in all this, I'm just the messenger.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: We return to Orleans... across the bridge, at the Tourelles.

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: But the bridge has been pulled down!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: The English are rebuilding it.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Clear?

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Perfectly.

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: You look disappointed... Isn't this what you wanted?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No... not like this...

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: For weeks you've been asking for this... well now you have it!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Jeanne... let him do it.  One more dead body's not going to make any difference, so who cares?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I care!  And I care because God cares!  All life is precious to God -- even his -- even yours and mine...

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Bravo!  What about all the other hundreds of prisoners?  Do we let them go too?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Maybe... I don't know... but first we have to confess...

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Jeanne... The men are exhausted!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I know, but so is the enemy -- they're falling back -- Paris is ours...!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Jeanne... we're not enough...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: So... bring up the reinforcements!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Reinforcements?  Where??

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Right behind us -- Dunois with another then thousand men!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Jeanne, look behind you.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Never look behind -- only ahead!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Do you know how to count?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Of course I do?  Bring them up!

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: Jeanne... that is not ten thousand reinforcements -- that is one hundred very loyal but very tired soldiers.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: But... where is Dunois... where are the men the king promised me?

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: He never sent them... Don't you understand?  He doesn't want this war anymore... he has his crown now, that's all he ever wanted...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: But my voices... they promised me...

turns.speaker: GILLES
turns.text: To hell with your voices -- it's time to face facts!  We have nothing to do here... none of us... not even you.  You should go home, Jeanne.

turns.speaker: JEAN LE MAISTRE
turns.text: Who told you to wear men's clothes?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: The clothes are not important...

turns.speaker: JEAN LE MAISTRE
turns.text: You also cut your hair short like a man, and in the Bible it clearly states that it is an abomination for a woman to pretend to be a man!  It proves your desire to deceive...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: It was just... more convenient as I was among soldiers...

turns.speaker: JEAN LE MAISTRE
turns.text: So you think you did well to cut your hair and dress as a man?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I... submit to Our Lord.

turns.speaker: JEAN LE MAISTRE
turns.text: But will you also submit to the decision of the Church?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: It seems to me that the Church and Our Lord are one and the same.  Why must you complicate what is so simple?

turns.speaker: JEAN MIDI
turns.text: Tell us, Jeanne... why did you jump from the tower at Beaurevoir?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I had been sold to the English.  I'd rather die than fall into their hands.

turns.speaker: JEAN MIDI
turns.text: Did your voice tell you to jump?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No...

turns.speaker: JEAN MIDI
turns.text: So when you jumped, you wanted to kill yourself?

turns.speaker: JEAN MIDI
turns.text: How can you deny it when you just said "I'd rather die than fall into the hands of the English"...?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: That's now what I meant...

turns.speaker: JEAN MIDI
turns.text: Do you not know that suicide is a very grievous sin?  No one is allowed to destroy the life that God created!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I know, but that's not the way things happened...

turns.speaker: JEAN MIDI
turns.text: You mean it was not of your own free will that you were on the ledge?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes, but...

turns.speaker: JEAN MIDI
turns.text: And you didn't jump of your free will?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: JEAN MIDI
turns.text: Oh?  Perhaps someone pushed you then?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Stop it!  What are you doing?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Nothing... just taking his teeth.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: But you can't just kill a man for his teeth!

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Why not?  He has good teeth...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Because... because you just can't!

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Besides, what about these...?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: That's different... I mean... we were fighting for a... for a cause!

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Here -- take this instead.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: So who gave the order to bring me to this side of the river??

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Hey, my friend!  I'm glad to see your ugly damn face again!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: La Hire, I'm warning you -- don't swear!

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Sorry Jeanne...  Did you both meet already?

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Jeanne, let me introduce the king's half brother, the dogged Lord Dunois.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Then, Lord Dunois, show me the way to the other side of the river...

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Jesus Christ... the goddamn English will pay for this!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: They will -- and so will you if you go on swearing like that.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: What happened?  Who gave the order to attack?

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: God knows, but it was a bad idea!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Were the men confessed?  Where are the priests?

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: I swear I'll never swear again in my life if you save her life!  But I'm warning you, if you let her die, then you're the biggest...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Don't swear...

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Physicians are a waste of time. You'll have more luck with this charm of mine... it saved my life at Agincourt!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I'd sooner die than use magic!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Prepare these as battering-rams!

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: What's the use?  The drawbridge is up!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Not for long...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: We... won?!

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Won?!  Such a small word will never do!  This is victory, Jeanne, this is... glory!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: You call this... glory...?  All this... this blood... this smell of...

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: ... the smell of victory, Jeanne! Mmmmmmm!  I love it!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: It's not possible...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Take mine instead -- here -- smash mine first!

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Jeanne... get up... this is ridiculous...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: If you kill him, you kill me!

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Jeanne... the man hasn't been paid for six months -- that's his only reward.  Let him take a few teeth...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: A few teeth... that's the price of his life?

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: Jeanne, if you don't mind... I'll stay standing... this armor... it's a nightmare to get back up...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I said, kneel!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: You don't believe me anymore?

turns.speaker: LA HIRE
turns.text: We still believe in you, Jeanne.  If it were up to me, I'd chase every goddamn Englishman into the ocean. But it's not up to us anymore -- it's up to the king...

turns.speaker: MAITRE MAURICE
turns.text: When you were taken prisoner at Compiegne, did you have a horse?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes... a half-steed... white.

turns.speaker: MAITRE MAURICE
turns.text: Who gave you that horse?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: My king.

turns.speaker: MAITRE MAURICE
turns.text: How many did he give you?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Five steeds and a few hackneys...

turns.speaker: MAITRE MAURICE
turns.text: As much as for a Lord?  What an honor!  Did your king give you other wealth apart from horses?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MAITRE MAURICE
turns.text: What about all those dresses you were given... silk dresses weren't they?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes, I was given a few, but I never had time to wear them...

turns.speaker: MAITRE MAURICE
turns.text: Still, pretty wealthy for a peasant girl wouldn't you say?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: And you look pretty wealthy for a servant of God, wouldn't you say?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Jeanne... what are you doing?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Playing...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What have you done to me?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Who... who are you...?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I am that I am.  You don't like my face?  Maybe you prefer this one...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Who are you to even think you can know the difference between good and evil?  Are you God?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No... no... I'm just a messenger... He needs me... a higher calling...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I don't know... I thought...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: YOU THINK GOD ISN'T BIG ENOUGH TO DELIVER HIS OWN MESSAGES?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I don't know... please... tell me I'm dead...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: WHO ARE YOU TO DECIDE IF YOU SHOULD LIVE OR DIE?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I... don't know... what do you want from me?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Nothing.  I'm here to set you free...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: What are you doing out here?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I might ask you the same question.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I... I'm leaving... I can't take anymore...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: And what exactly is it that you can't take anymore of?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Everything!  Prison -- humiliation -- being abandoned and betrayed by everyone -- I can't stand it anymore -- I'd rather die!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You'll be dead soon enough anyway, so why be in such a hurry?  Why not face up to your lies?  It's your lies you can't stand anymore...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I... I never lied!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: If you were true to yourself... if your faith was firm, you wouldn't need to run away from yourself like this...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I am true -- to my Lord, the King of Heaven.  He knows how much I love him -- that's all that matters to me...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: How can you pretend that you love God when you're about to throw away the most precious thing he gave you? Life is a gift, you should know that by now Jeanne -- a gift from God. You know what He'd say to you, if He was here?  "What are you doing to me, Jeanne?"

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: That's too easy.  One minute you want to die, the next you want to live...  Do you think that life is a toy that can be played with and then broken when you don't want it anymore?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No, no... I'm just so tired, and lost, and... I didn't realize what I was doing!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh?  And just because you realize now, everybody else should forgive you?!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I don't know -- I don't care anymore -- I just want to be at peace!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh, so you don't want war anymore? You want to be at peace?  You want to be able to change your mind anytime you feel like it and expect everyone to go along with it?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I don't understand.  What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I told you already... I'm here to set you free...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Why were you yelling like that?!

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: What are you doing here?  Please... leave... you can't stay here...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Why?  Are you waiting for someone else?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: My... visions...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: They're going to come and visit you in here?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes... that's what I pray for...!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I want to see that.  Do you mind if I stay... on the side?  I won't bother you.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No, no -- you can't stay or they won't come!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Because... I have to be alone!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: They won't come anyway.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: What do you mean, they won't come?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Why would they?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Because!  Because I've always been faithful to God, and I've followed everything he said... and I've done everything he asked me...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: God asked you to do something?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes... lots of things!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You mean God said, "I need you, Jeanne?"

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No, but... he sent me so many signs!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What signs?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Like... like the wind... and the clouds... and... the bells... and what about that sword lying in the field... that was a sign...!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: No.  That was a sword in a field.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: But... it didn't just get there by itself.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: True -- every event has an infinite number of causes -- but why pick one rather than another?  There are many ways a sword might find itself in a field...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I'm not lying, I... I can't remember... leave me alone!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh?  You can't remember?  Let me help your memory...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No!  I don't want to know anymore! Leave me alone!  I didn't kill that man!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Oh no?  How about this one?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Stop, stop... I can't remember!  The battles were all so confusing... there was so much smoke, dust, noise... I was being attacked on all sides, so... maybe... perhaps I fought back but it was only to defend myself...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: So your memory's coming back?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes... yes!  And now you tell me why God let all these battles happen in the first place... if he's so powerful... he said he's "the creator of heaven and earth, the source of all life..." he could have easily stopped all this blood and misery?  Why didn't he?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Is he the one who spread all this blood and misery?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No, but... why didn't he stop it? Or did he get pleasure, watching us killing each other in his name?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: In His name??

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes!  We fought and killed in His name... the King of Heaven!

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: "Let all who love me follow me"... Where does God get mentioned?  Come on Jeanne, be honest.  You fought for yourself, in your name.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I... I was defending myself as best I could!  Everyone has the right to defend themselves, don't they?  Or should I have let myself be killed?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: No, no, you did fine.  I'd even say well done.  Besides, most of the ones you killed probably deserved it, don't you think?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No, I do not think so.  I don't think that killing each other will ever bring peace.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I agree...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I don't agree.  Why do you have to keep changing your mind all the time?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Why are you doing this to me??  Do you get pleasure from hurting me?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Ah, pleasure... that's a difficult word to define.  When does the pain end and the pleasure begin...? When did your pleasure begin with that sword in your hand...?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I never took pleasure in hurting anyone?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I -- I cleaned up my room, look... and I said my prayers... all of them... and...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What are you doing on the wall?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: I'm trying to make my cross look more beautiful...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Because... because I don't know what else to do to please him.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Do you think this cross will protect you?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: No, I...

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: "Love your enemies"...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Good.  But "love your enemies"... body and soul.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: My voices... my voices... do you think they will ever come back?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I don't think so.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Are you going to leave me too?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Yes... of course... when you don't need me anymore.

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Are you sent by God?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: There's nothing for me to do here anymore... I don't belong here I want to be with Him now...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Do you think you are ready?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes I am.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Are you willing to follow all His commandments?

turns.speaker: JEANNE
turns.text: Yes...

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: ... to love your enemy as much as you love yourself?
